intro: Beta cicla var. viridis, commonly known as the green leafed beet, is a variety of the leaf beet family characterized by its vibrant green foliage. This plant is native to temperate regions and thrives in cool, moist climates. Its leaves are tender and often used in culinary applications, though they are less common than other beet varieties. The plant has a short growing season and is typically harvested before it becomes too fibrous. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its attractive, shiny green leaves.
